alert.note: Alert for Habersham; Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 8:16AM EDT until September 06 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Georgia, including the following counties, Habersham and Rabun. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall due to persistent, repeating heavy showers. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past 3 hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area through noon, with further heavy rain possible this afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, and this could worsen this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarkesville, Tiger, Lake Burton, Lake Rabun, Seed Lake and Batesville. Flooding is most likely along the Soquee River channel, Raper Creek, Slick Shoal Creek, and tributaries to the Tallulah River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
